page.title: 09LANDSCAPE AROUND NEWQUAY
page.content: {TREWOLLACK FARM}was built in 1820, but there has been another house built there more recently. The farm is owned by the {DUCHY OF CORNWALL} and has the three feathers to represent it. The farm covers 310 acres and includes beef cattle but no milking cattle. They have 500 sheep with lambs which are sold for meat. They have 10 acres of hay and other crops, but mostly grass for grazing. Also there is an old mine on the farm and the shaft is one of the deepest in Cornwall at 600 feet. Next to the old {FAIRPARK {SCHOOL}which is not in use anymore, there are some newly built houses. These are timber framed with block work that is shingled on the outside.Shingling is gravel thrown onto the walls as a protection from the weather.
